reviews.sentence: Not quite what it used to be. Location old world charm beautiful large rooms. We were really looking forward to staying at the FCC in Angkor. Having visited Angkor Wat and Siem Reap numerous times and also having dined quite a few times at the FCC before we had very high expectations. Unfortunately these were not quite met. Whilst the rooms are beautiful and the hotel itself is stunning everything seems a little tired and not as well polished as it could be. Breakfast was a challenge every day something that could easily be resolved if the staff was trained properly. The fact that all the dirty dishes from dinner are piled up in a corner right by the entrance of the hotel just makes everything feel dirty and messy. We love the place and believe it has all the ingredients to make an outstanding hotel experience but it needs more love and care.

Overpriced. I stayed in this hotel 6 years ago in a better room for 100 a night. This time I paid 250 for a lesser room 450 on New Years Eve. I enjoyed my previous stay so much that I took the plunge again but sadly the room I was given was dated had cracks in the tiles and a leaking toilet. I was moved the day after when I complained but even though the room we moved to was less dated it was small and not worth the inflated price I paid. Breakfast in the restaurant was nice but you had to pay extra if you wanted anything more than eggs. The location is great.

Poor arrival and rubbish breakfast pool. We visited in early January 2015. The room was a bit old fashioned. Very dark wood. Leaking toilet. Although the staff did respond fast on the two occasions it needed fixing. The was a blind which was quite effective in making the room very claustrophobic. However the alternative was to open the whole frontage of the room to free view for all passers by. When you arrive at the hotel the reception is very small and you are shoulder to shoulder with people leaving or with other guests. All pretty cramped. The pool is very poorly designed. There is virtually no sun as the sun beds are on the wrong side of the pool. The worst and most surreal experience was breakfast. There is no buffet. So you just get a set menu. No top ups of juice or tea coffee. The choice was two items of a very limited menu eg cereal and toast or hot meal. This place needs a major revamp.

Adequate but uninspiring. The service was beyond slow and we were one of two couples in the restaurant at 110. The menu was very limited but the food was okay and nicely presented. I ordered Kampot Pepper Ice Tea but they were out of it so I had the lemon ice tea. It arrived with a long black hair floating in it. It was replaced but then the waiter charged us for three of them instead of two my dining partner had also ordered it. I was disappointed as a colleague had raved about the place several months earlier. There are much better places to eat along the river and on Wat Bo Street.
The worst restaurant I have been to in Cambodia. The food was unbelievably bad while the price is way higher than a decent restaurant. I would rate this restaurant 6 stars if I could.

Ms Sally Roesler. an excellent choice for ones stay in Siam Reapremoved from the hustle of down town. a peaceful relaxing ambianceI truly believe I could retire to this hotel. one must at least dine at the restaurant while visiting this historic city.

Beautiful Hotel Close to Everything. Apart from the problem of the hotel not having our booking when we arrived our 3 night stay here was perfect. The hotel is beautiful. Because of the mix up we ended up with a family room which was absolutely huge. Fresh fruit was brought to the room each day together with lotus blossoms. The staff are all really friendly. The food was wonderful and really well presented. The hotel is right on the river. The market is about a 10 minute walk away where you can buy all kinds of souvenirs. Pub Street is about 15 minutes walk away which is worth visiting at least one night while you are there. There are numerous tuk tuks around which all seem to cost 3 wherever you want to go. Angkor Wat is about 30 minutes or so away but we had an organised trip to see this. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to stay in Siem Reap.
Nice hotel. The Spa was great. Staff could do with more training in the resturant.
Generally good. but they need to polish up in a few areas. Great location friendly staff Good food. Rooms very dark they need a re furbishing Breakfast staff slow and disorganised.

Excellent Venue. Hotel is easy going nothing is too much trouble for the staff who are so friendly. My only criticism is over the breakfast choice. Needs to have more variety but I understand there is now a new chef overseeing this so hopefully this will be sorted very soon.
Great location food and staff. Wonderful pool at the end of a hot day. Location central. Good dining room with excellent Khmer food and breakfast. No rain.

Perfect. We were staying in Siem Reap for 3 nights at the end of our Cambodia trip and decided to stay here because it looked a bit different. When we arrived at the hotel the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Our room was great the included breakfast was excellent and they even have the option to have it in your room if you need to very early in the morning. We took the option for a tuk tuk tour of Angkor Wat from the hotel it was reasonably priced the easiest and most enjoyable way to see it. If I am ever in Siem Reap again I will definitely stay here.
Highly recommended delightful place to stay well away from the Angkor tour groups. Calm and delightful ambience. Good staff beds and restaurant bar. Nothing.

Brilliant great base for the area. Great breakfast included a la carte 5 or 6 main types of cooked breakfast you could order. Big rooms interjoining for teenage kidsso helpful stafGreat restaurant and reasonable prices for high standard fodrestaurant very colonial feeling period sofas nice bar and outdoor seatingEven their FCC food outlet at the airport was the same prices as in the hotel excellent considering every other food outlet triples prices for lower standard food at the airport10 minute walk or 3 min tuk tuk to old market area. Great tour organization to the Angkors really helpful and informative guide and driver. My wife said the hairdryer was not powerful enough. I said we are all professionals we will rise above it.

Great place. We had dinner at FCC last night. it is a beautiful restaurant and it has great atmosphere. They had live music by a woman singing and a man playing on the guitar and singing. Great music attentive service. We had a green mango salad and bruscheta for appetizers they were great. I had fried rice and my daughter had a curry for the main courses which were good. My husband ordered grilled beef which looked great on the picture but was disappointing. All in all the restaurant is definitely worth a visit. we are planning to go back for drinks.

The authentic unpretentious ambience of FCC gives a memorable experience of Cambodia. The elegant modern design of the rooms the hotel which is an extension of an old colonial villa set in lush green compound. The dark saltwater pool with tall mature trees soaring above is the best feature of the hotel besides the old colonial villa with its restaurant and verandah overlooking the Siem Reap river. Unfortunately the food in the lovely restaurant is average and uninspired. Service is sluggish staff appears bored and cheerless. Reception lobby looks dated and cramped. A newer landscape pool garden features have spoilt the previous colonial ambience of the compound. Next door seems to be the site of a large new addition to the hotel so it may soon be next to a construction site.
Simply amazing. Outstanding food and definitely the best meal we had in Siem Reap. Slightly slow on the service but we were in no rush so it was all good.

After renovation. We visited FCC Angkor just a few days after finishing renovation. The former governors mansion was really well renovated and the kitchen was superb. Fine and attentive staff. We enjoyed a full dinner and was impressed by the performance of the kitchen.

Fabulous. Beautiful property in a fantastic location ideal for all the main attractions beautiful bar and restaurant most of all the staff are amazing. Big thank you to the management staff Denis and Mark for making it a truly memorable stay. Highly recommend.

Excellent restaurant. We visited this hotel the former French Governors Residence and its restaurant for 2 evening dinners during a recent 3 night stay in Siem Reap we were staying nearby. The hotel restaurant and outside bar are absolutely beautifully appointed and presented. On one evening we enjoyed pre dinner fizz sat outside by the bar and then ventured upstairs where we sat outside on a narrow terrace at a table for 2 it was so perfect and the gardens and riverside were lit up very romantic. The staff are lovely really welcoming helpful friendly and professional. The menu offered just what we were looking for as we were nearing the end of our holiday and just fancied some foods other than local cuisine. Perfect location fabulous ambience and absolutely stunning. Highly recommend and would suggest booking especially if you would like to sit out side for evening dinner.
